page.title: 11A Walk in Wyver Lane,Belper
page.content: There is rough grazing land at{Wyver {Farm}covered with sheep and cows. On the left is a wood and there are chestnut trees,oak and hawthorn. On the right is marsh and water meadow. We saw a wren and a blue tit. The water meadow is like a pond but not made of concrete or stone.It is a natural pond. Ducks fly on it and fish swim in it.There are trout,pike,roach, perch and tench. There is a fishing club. Further along is a disused dump. There is a Rifle Range but it is not used any more. As we walked along we saw several trains. There was the{Inter-City}to Birmingham,coal for powerstations and local train,Belper to Matlock.The line is main-line to the North.One was only one coach and was a railway laboratory Trains pass every few minutes. { }
